title: Helicase/nucleic acid processing gene detector
description: This feature detects a specific sequence motif or structural element commonly found in bacterial helicase genes and related nucleic acid processing enzymes. The activation pattern shows consistent sharp spikes within or at the boundaries of these genes across phylogenetically diverse bacteria. The feature appears to recognize a functionally important sequence signature associated with enzymes that manipulate DNA or RNA structure, particularly those involved in unwinding, repair, recombination, or transcriptional regulation. The pattern is highly consistent across examples and appears to be conserved across multiple bacterial phyla, suggesting it detects an evolutionarily conserved element with important functional significance in nucleic acid metabolism.
